title: All in all... I’m pleased
text: I have 4 stars because of some minor issues but for the most part, I am pleased with this purchase. I had a slight problem setting it up there was slight differences in the LED color that the directions explained versus what the actual color was for the setup process (the camera has an LED that can display in different colors). The live feed for me is only off by about a second or two off (not too bad). When I’m home I turn the camera off but there seems to be a delay when I turn it back on before it reconnects (about 3-4 minutes or so). There again, for the price I paid I thought it was well worth the small investment and I’m pretty pleased. I would recommend this product.

title: Works
text: System works well and customer assistance is helpful. If I could change one thing, I’d rearrange the app menu because I always accidentally navigate to the “Groups” or “Layout” items which are unhelpful to me as I only have one camera.

title: Erratic performance
text: The camera is glitchy when trying to set it up-which happens with setup after power dips. It can’t “see” the internet. Snagging wi-fi can take very long. It searches until you give up and have to start over. The camera doesn’t catch all activity. It’s impossible to know what it will record or won’t. It often over-heats. Picture quality is good. It never plays the video in the larger screen, only in the event list. Better than Wyze that charges you to use features that come with the camera. And Wyze uses your email to annoy you with endless ads and sales pitches for other products.

title: Worked well then not so good lately
text: I installed two Oco Bullet cams around the property and opted for the paid subscription for both.  Since the wireless feature wasn't reliable, I ran long Ethernet cables through the attic directly to our WiFi router.  The app worked pretty well in the beginning but lately I haven't been receiving text notifications no matter which sensitivity setting I'm on.  I can access the short video clips if I log on, but I'm not receiving the push notifications which is the whole point of having these cameras.   I've tried deleting and reinstalling the app on my iPhone and iPad to no avail.  I'll try account support but it shouldn't be this iffy.

title: Excellent customer service
text:
Bought my camera in December 2020. It stopped working in March. The helpline was unable to fix it. Emailed me a preprinted UPS label. Returned it and they shipped another one. Company stood behind their service 100%. Will do business with ivideon and recommend it.

The only two minor issues, (1) the instructions on the first camera said to use oco app. Which does not work. Had to calm helpline who guided me

(2) Unable to share the feed through the app. Says generic error.

title: Very Frustrating
text: I own 3 OCO cameras. I would like to say they perform beautifully, but they don’t. They routinely overheat. The red light flashes for no reason and video feed stops. Night vision comes on during the day. Sitting 5 feet from the router and despite a very strong signal, they struggle to find my wi-fi. I sit with one of the three every day,  erase the camera, reconnect the camera and maybe I get six hours without a problem. I wave to these glitzy cameras in their field of vision and wait for the motion alert  to come. It rarely does. How much else happens on my property that I don’t see because of this defective product line? None of the three I own consistently see motion. I won’t buy another OCO.

title: Nice product
text: Nice product for people like myself without a NVR for my network cameras. I set it up to save to a auxiliary hard drive that’s plugged into my computer so the files aren’t save directly to the computer. The options I’m sure are more than I am using but in the week I have been using it, love that now my cameras files are being recorded to a portable hard drive when motion is detected.

title: Great customer support
text: I had an issue where the camera would not connect.  After several attempts at trying guiding me through a fix, they connected to my computer and had it fixed within minutes.  I even received an email from the founder and CEO asking if the problem was solved to my satisfaction.

title: Excellent
text: The iVideon app provides an excellent interface to their server software and the associated video file. title: Not suitable as a baby monitor
text:
This app has a great feature set, unfortunately the features do not work.  

1) The app as a rule has roughly 8 seconds delay from the time something happens to when you see or hear it. 
2) The image quality settings do not appear to do anything.  I set mine to always use low because the drops outs and lag were so bad.  Despite this, it still appears to try to optimize the image resolution.  It then drops out when an event occurs as it buffers and reduces the quality.   So you neither hear not see the triggering event.  
3) The persistent audio feature doesn't work consistently.  Sometimes it turns off as soon as the display shuts off (I found pushing the app to the background before turning off the display sometimes helps this). Sometimes it turns off when it has a lag event.  And finally sometimes it will work for hours and then shut off at an unknown time in the middle of the night leaving you in a panic over the health of your newborn that you were listening to. 

I believe a couple of the issues are:
1) The fact that all of the data collected from the cameras must be uploaded to ivideon's servers and then streamed to the device.  This might make sense for remote access, but not if both devices are on the same network.  It is hugely inefficient and simply doesn't work as implemented.  
2) The previously mentioned attempt by the app to always use the maximum image resolution.  The advertised image quality just isn't supportable as currently implemented.  

I am running this on iPhone 5s, with an always up to date OS.  I have an Asus RT-AC66U gigabit router running on Xfinity cable internet in a suburb. There should be no bandwidth issues in this signal chain.  

As the title says, this app is not useful as a baby monitor.  I will keep looking for a better implementation of the concepts attempted by this app.

title: Watching Grandma
text: This camera changed my life. My 101 year old mother lives with us and has dementia. The 24 hour record of sound and motion and the alerts to my phone give me the freedom to  be away for short periods and still know what is happening with her. At first she thought it was "nosey" to have a camera in her room. Now in the morning she asks me how much she was up overnight. For the price of a few hours of a hired caregiver I have 24/7/365 eyes on Grandma. Highly recommend.
